pr_title: fix(plugins): Misc. fixes in path to downloading and loading configured plugin version

timeline.message: fix(plugins): Misc. fixes in path to downloading and loading configured plugin version

timeline.bodyText: This was moved to a different properties file and no longer necessary here.
timeline.author: jonsie

timeline.bodyText: Apparently, availablePlugins only returns the available plugins that are not yet loaded by the plugin manager.  This will allow us to determine the release against all plugins.
timeline.author: jonsie
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -53,8 +53,8 @@ class ExtensionBeanDefinitionRegistryPostProcessor(
     // 1) Load plugins prior to downloading so we can resolve what needs to be updated
     pluginManager.loadPlugins()
 
-    // 2) Determine the plugins for release from the list of available plugins
-    val releases = pluginInfoReleaseProvider.getReleases(updateManager.availablePlugins)
+    // 2) Determine the plugins for release from the list of plugins
+    val releases = pluginInfoReleaseProvider.getReleases(updateManager.plugins)

timeline.bodyText: We should be making a point of building all our plugins with the Plugin-Version attribute (which we aren't doing in the helloworld plugin I was testing with), but just to be safe this will force us to use the correctly configured version.
timeline.author: jonsie

replies.bodyText: I thought this was being populated by the gradle project?
replies.author: robzienert

timeline.bodyText: Since we don't ask Front50 for file + extension type (though it is constructed in Front50's PluginBinaryController) we need to do this to correctly save the file (otherwise it is saved as a binary file with no extension).
timeline.author: jonsie
